snippet: Despite rejections announced by hard-liners in both political factions recently, the envoy said he was hopeful that a vote would soon go before Parliament.
abstract: United Nations envoy to Libya is hopeful that two main rival groups will eventually form unity government, in accord with popular will, despite rejection of peace plan by hard-line faction.
lead_paragraph: Despite rejections announced by hard-liners in both political factions recently, the envoy said he was hopeful that a vote would soon go before Parliament.

headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Libya: U.N. Envoy Expects More Talks Over Formation of a Unity Government
headline.main: U.N. Envoy Says Libya Peace Process Will Continue
